intro: Aeschynomene paludosa, commonly known as swamp bluemink, is a flowering plant native to wetland habitats in tropical and subtropical regions. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, herbaceous stems and small, delicate flowers. The plant typically grows in marshy or aquatic environments, where it can thrive in saturated soils. Its leaves are alternate and trifoliate, with each leaflet being oval-shaped and slightly hairy. Aeschynomene paludosa plays a role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for various small organisms.
